body.p: Paragraph 36(b) requires an entity to describe collateral available as security for assets it holds and other credit enhancements obtained. An entity might meet this requirement by disclosing:

li.p: the policies and processes for valuing and managing collateral and other credit enhancements obtained;

a description of the main types of collateral and other credit enhancements (examples of the latter being guarantees, credit derivatives, and netting agreements that do not qualify for offset in accordance with IAS 32);
the main types of counterparties to collateral and other credit enhancements and their creditworthiness; and
information about risk concentrations within the collateral or other credit enhancements.
